verses.roman:
prabhu tāṅre hasta sparśi' karāilā cetana
sannyāsīra veṣa dekhi' vismita haila mana

synonyms: prabhu—the Lord; tāṅre—unto Rāmānanda Rāya; hasta—the hand; sparśi'-touching; karāilā—made; cetana—conscious; sannyāsīra—of the sannyāsī; veṣa—the dress; dekhi'-seeing; vismita—struck with wonder; haila—became; mana—the mind.
translation: When Rāmānanda Rāya fell to the ground unconscious, Caitanya Mahāprabhu touched his hand, and he immediately regained consciousness. But when he saw Lord Caitanya in the dress of a sannyāsī, he was struck with wonder.
